title: Johnson apologises for video but still denies Christmas party
content: The PM pledges an inquiry into what happened but Labour leader Keir Starmer says he is "taking the public for fools".

title: Johnson apologises for video but still denies Christmas party
content: The PM pledges an inquiry into what happened but Labour leader Keir Starmer says he is "taking the public for fools".

title: Scholz becomes German leader as Merkel bows out
content: Olaf Scholz is sworn in as chancellor, leading a three-party coalition after 16 years of Merkel rule.

title: Vaccines should work against Omicron, WHO says
content: A small study in South Africa suggests the new variant could partially evade the Pfizer jab.

title: Girls’ despair as Taliban confirm Afghan school ban
content: The BBC hears about the ban's harmful impact from teachers and students in 13 Afghan provinces.

title: Finnish PM sorry for clubbing after Covid contact
content: Sanna Marin went on a night out on Saturday, hours after her foreign minister had tested positive.

title: US father fired on Zoom describes 'callous' call
content: Dad of five Christian was one of 900 Better.com employees laid-off on a Zoom call, weeks before Christmas.

title: Fish 'whoops and growls’ heard on restored reef
content: Recordings of fish 'whooping, croaking and growling' reveal reef coming back to life, scientists say.

title: Japanese billionaire blasts off to play golf in space
content: Yusaku Maezawa will spend 12 days at the International Space Station before returning to Earth.

title: India's top general in helicopter crash
content: Chief of Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat was in the helicopter which crashed in southern India.

title: China is biggest captor of journalists - report
content: Advocacy group Reporters Without Borders said at least 127 journalists are currently detained.

title: Lecturers in court over sex for grades in Morocco
content: They are charged with incitement to debauchery, gender discrimination and violence against women.

title: Lecturers in court over sex for grades in Morocco
content: They are charged with incitement to debauchery, gender discrimination and violence against women.

title: Comedian Nick Cannon announces death of young son
content: The American's five-month-old son Zen died after having had a brain tumour, he said on his show.

title: Myanmar soldiers accused of shooting villagers
content: Myanmar villagers say soldiers carried out the killings in response to an attack on a military convoy.

title: Never-before-seen photos show Epstein-Maxwell bond
content: FBI agents submit previously unseen photo evidence as third accuser testifies in Maxwell trial.

title: Former Afghan child refugee - now a top lawyer
content: The latest global news, sport, weather and documentaries
